result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry D Hawkins

records.addlTxt:
2:07 PM Defendant Larry D Hawkins in court.  Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides in court for Larry D Hawkins.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Beth Raymond in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on December 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 9:00 p.m. and 5:00 a.m. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

2:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Larry D Hawkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Larry D Hawkins. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
